answers.answer: Stress is not going to help anything. Just relax. Your doctor would have tested sooner if he/ she had a reason to worry.
My doctor hasn't don't alot of test normal doctors do Idk why

Some of the symptoms include high blood pressure and protein in your urine. They should be checking both of those at every appointment which would let them know if they needed to check further or do more tests I believe.
But if you are having other symptoms that youre worried about you should definitely let the dr know.

You;re tested for preeclampsia at every visit. That's why they have you pee in a cup at your appointments.  You must have no concerns or they'd have mentioned it to you.  I had pregnancy hypertension which is, you now, the thing that happens before preeclampsia and they never did anything other than check my urine as they do all pregnant women at each visit to see if there is protein.  If you are swelling a good deal, they'll push o it to see if it is pitting and they don't say anything.  I was 10 days past my due date and at about 39 weeks, they pushed one time on my swelling.  I've read a lot so knew what they were doing but they didn't say anything.  So, I'm sure your doctor is taking care of you and you just don't realize it.  good luck
I haven't had to pee in a cup that is why I'm worried!?!?!?!?!?

question: I'm 36 weeks and I haven't Ben tested for Preclampsia at all...my sister had it with her pregnancy. And now I think I may have it. I have an appointment on Friday should I wait or should I call and see if they can get me in sooner. I just really worried...
title: really worried
